name: Stef's Slow Cooker Creme Brulee
author: cupcakeproject
summary: Creme brulee cooked in the slow cooker is an easy way to prepare this creamy dessert and you only need 5 simple ingredients. These can be baked and chilled 2 days ahead. Cover ramekins after chilling 3 hours to prevent condensation on the surface of the custards.
directions: Whisk yolks with 1/4 cup sugar and salt in a bowl until smooth; gently whisk in cream and vanilla extract
Strain custard mixture into a liquid measuring cup
Line bottom of a 6-quart oval slow cooker with a folded kitchen towel to create a level surface so ramekins won't slide around
Set four 4-ounce ramekins on the towel
Fill slow cooker with enough water to come halfway up sides of ramekins
Drape paper towels over top of slow cooker liner to absorb any condensation during baking; cover with lid to secure
Cook on Low until custard is set but jiggles slightly, about 2 hours
Transfer ramekins to a rack to cool completely, about 45 minutes
Refrigerate custards, uncovered, until cold, at least 3 hours
Sprinkle 1 teaspoon sugar over each ramekin and shake gently to distribute evenly
Heat the sugar using a culinary torch until melted and browned, about 1 minute
